problem: Find the sum of the first five terms in the geometric sequence $\frac13,\frac19,\frac1{27},\dots$. Express your answer as a common fraction.
solution: This is a finite geometric series with first term $\frac13$ and common ratio $\frac13$. There are five terms, so the sum of this series is $\frac{\frac13\left(1-\left(\frac13\right)^5\right)}{1-\frac13} = \boxed{\frac{121}{243}}$.
chatgpt_solution: The first term is $\frac13$ and the common ratio is $\frac19\div\frac13=\frac19\cdot\frac31=\frac13$. The sum of the first five terms is  $$\frac{\frac13(1-\left(\frac13\right)^5)}{1-\frac13}=\frac{\frac13\left(1-\frac1{3^5}\right)}{\frac23}=\frac{2\cdot\frac13\left(1-\frac1{3^5}\right)}{3}=\boxed{\frac{121}{729}}.$$
